model_input:
[Task Description]
You will be given DIALOGUE CONTEXT and MEMORY.
Your job is to judge if MEMORY contains helpful past information for a language model, representing Speaker A, to generate a proper next response based on DIALOGUE CONTEXT.

If the DIALOUGE CONTEXT does not require the model to utilize past information for response generation, say "N/A".
Say "Yes" if MEMORY contains such helpful information and say "No" if it dose not.
Provide a brief explanation for your judgement.

[Format Regulation]
Generate your output below OUTPUT using the following format:
Brief explanation: your explanation
Judgement: "Yes", "No", or "N/A"

[Task]
DIALOGUE CONTEXT:
Speaker A: Do you use technology like text messaging to interact with your grandkids?
Speaker B: No I can't get my head round it, I much rather a good ol fashioned phone call!
Speaker A: I have had to learn just to keep in touch with my family because of my hours at my job. It is not easy, I understand.
Speaker B: Well thankfully I don't have that problem these days, I get to spend some great time with my grandkids. Have you thought any more about the idea of our annual fishing trip? 
Speaker A: Yes, I think you should start planning this with your family and try and do different locations every year so that it changes up the scenery
Speaker B: Yes I think that's a great idea, how is work at the library? 
Speaker A: Busy, and demanding because we are short staffed. While there seems to be little need for a library these days, I find that we have less staff to get everything done
Speaker B: Well if you ever need someone to come and help for a couple of hours here and there, give me a call, you know how much I love to be in the library anyway

[MEMORY]
Speaker A is a librarian and loves kids, mentioning having 3 children. Speaker B's mother was a librarian, which seems to have influenced their perspective on the job. Speaker A is a retired librarian who enjoys implementing creative activities in their library. 

Speaker B's kids do not go to work by boat like Speaker A. Speaker A has kids and is busy with work, unable to spend as much time with them as they would like. Speaker B has grandkids and enjoys spending time with them at the park. Speaker B took their grandkids fishing once, with mixed reactions from the kids. 

Speaker B has a lot of kids, all grown up now and with kids of their own. Speaker A has kids and is busy with work, unable to spend as much time with them as they would like. Speaker B has grandkids and enjoys spending time with them at the park. Speaker B likes the idea of making the fishing trip an annual tradition to get the grandkids more interested in nature.

raw_prediction: Thank you, that's very kind of you to offer. I might take you up on that sometime, it would be nice to have the extra help.
prediction:
Brief explanation: The MEMORY provides helpful information such as Speaker A's profession, and their love for kids. It also gives details about Speaker B's family and their interests. It shows both Speaker A and Speaker B's relationship with their children and grandchildren which shapes the conversation they are having about incorporating fishing trips around their busy schedules. So, this MEMORY is helpful for generating an informed response.
Judgement: "Yes"
